channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH

item.description:
Report X-2024020886

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-02
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found 2-2 at 330pm in the unload area, carton was wet and was brought to QA for inspection DescribePack: inner container had a loose lid which caused internal leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ppe was used to contain package in a plastic hazmat bag which was then placed in a sealed plastic tote

item.title: Report E-2024020387
item.description:
Report E-2024020387

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 8, 2024, three (3) 5-gallon containers of isopropanol arrived damaged due to unknown causes and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the isopropanol-impacted trailer and concrete. TLE crews collected and containerized all impacted material into two (2) 55-gallon drums and staged them on site for transport and disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being RTS. Small hole near the top was discovered bubbling when being loaded. DescribePack: Hole is small. Approx 1-2mm DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was removed from loading area when bubbles were seen coming out of the small hole in the jerrican top.

item.title: Report X-2024020316
item.description:
Report X-2024020316

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-14
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFIED PERSONNEL CALLED ABOUT A WET DISTRESSED PACKAGE. WET BOX AND PRODUCT WAS PULLED OUT OF THE SYSTEM FLOW AND PLACED IN A LINED TOTE AND TAKEN HMPA FOR PROCESSING. DescribePack: INSUFFICIENT OUTER AND INNER PACKAGING ALLOWING MOVEMENT. LOOSE SPRAY TRIGGERS ALLOWING LEAKAGE TO OCCUR. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: WET CONTENTS AND WET BOX WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE TO PREVENT FURTHER LIQUID RELEASE FROM OCCURRING.

item.title: Report X-2024020448
item.description:
Report X-2024020448

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-22
  • City: TWINSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found damaged and was put into a damage tote for further processing. DescribePack: The bucket was loaded upside in the box causing it to eventually leak over time. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was put upright and oil dry was used to clean the leak. Package was then put into a salvage drum.
